verb.description: Admit that something is true or valid after first denying or resisting it.
examples: I had to concede that I'd overreacted
that principle now seems to have been conceded

verb.description: Surrender or yield (something that one possesses)
examples: to concede all the territory he'd won

origin: Late 15th century: from French concéder or Latin concedere, from con- completely + cedere yield.
